item.title: Problem viewing my applets
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

Yeah; sorry. Forgot to include that:

java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(Unknown Source) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

item.title: Problem viewing my applets
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Using your same example, it works perfectly fine for me. Couple of suggestions.

1: Ensure the Circle.java is compiled
2: Ensure the html file and class file are in the same directory

If neither of those help, does the browser (normally does in IE) give an error in the status bar?

item.title: Problem viewing my applets
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

First, off, the IDE I use is JCreator Light Edition. Just to test the applet output, I created a “Hello world” Applet, and compiled it in JCreator. However, when trying to open the .htm file it outputs, I get the classic ‘red X’ in the top left of the applet in my browser. I am pretty sure I have the JRE installed correctly, as I can load up and play runescape. I get the same problem with IE aswell. My default browser I use is firefox.

The code of the applet:

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.applet.;

public class Circle extends Applet {

public void init() {
}

public void paint(Graphics g) {
	
	g.drawString("Hello World!", 50, 60 );
	
}

}[/code]

And the resulting outputted HTML code:

[code]







[/code]

Read full topic
